title: VR-Based Forest Fire Suppression Training Program: Enhancing Real-World Response Capabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental fire safety concepts and outdoor activity experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning using VR equipment and personal devices, combining field training with theoretical instruction. Learners systematically acquire actual wildfire response capabilities through repetitive training in virtual environments

learning_goals: Perform initial response procedures (reporting, evacuation guidance, fire suppression equipment use) during wildfire scenarios in a virtual reality environment with 90% accuracy.
Evaluate the ability to predict wildfire spread patterns and develop suppression strategies via VR simulation (achieve 4 or higher on a 5-point scale).
Demonstrate theoretical and practical wildfire suppression competencies by scoring 85 or higher (out of 100) on a post-training knowledge test.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
